H0.text: When was the first road speed limit set in the UK for powered vehicles. 1830

H1.text: When was the first road speed limit set in the UK for powered vehicles. 1890

H2.text: When was the first road speed limit set in the UK for powered vehicles. 1840

H3.text: When was the first road speed limit set in the UK for powered vehicles. 1861

A4.text: A backlash against these large vehicles being used on roads resulted in legislation such as the UK Locomotives Act 1865.

A5.text: The 1861 Act introduced a UK speed limit of 10 mph (16 km/h) on open roads in town.

A6.text: The first numeric speed limit for mechanically propelled road vehicles was the 10 mph (16 km/h) limit introduced in the United Kingdom in 1861.
